title: Just Because ChatBots Can’t Think Doesn’t Mean They Can’t Lie

last_post.content:
Better people than me might be able to suppress a chuckle upon discovering that on the very same blog, Professor Cowen recently argued that Francis Bacon was a vehement opponent of the printing press — based on quotations that Bacon never wrote and which appear to have been generated by ChatGPT.

I don't know his GRE scores so I can't comment on their external validity, but given what I do know I can assure you that he's overpaid.

https://www.thenation.com/article/culture/internet-archive-publishers-lawsuit-chatbot/

title: Are Emergent Abilities of Large Language Models a Mirage?

last_post.content:
#LLMs #NewPreprintThread #neuroscience @cogsci @philosophy

1/n

Really interesting new preprint on emergence in LLMs. It raises a whole number of interesting issues, so some initial, first thoughts in the hope of prompting more discussion.

I also suspect this paper will generate a fair bit of confusion due to the central notion of 'emergence'

First off, the paper is looking at the issue of *how model capabilities develop as a function of model size.*

https://arxiv.org/abs/2304.15004

Gentle reminder: there are many blind and partially sighted users on the fediverse, and alt text is important for accessibility. It's becoming more and more commonplace that people won't boost toots with media that's either undescribed or lacking in a call for help with the alt text.

I have a guide here on how to write alt text, a bot you can follow if you keep forgetting, and options for asking for help with alt text:

https://mastodon.art/@Curator/109279035107793247

Please, alt-text your media. :bear_hugs:

Right now Graduate Workers at the University of Michigan are on strike trying to get a living wage for the work that they do. This time trans healthcare is also under debate as many grad workers can not access the care that they need.

When asked to improve access to trans healthcare, the University of Michigan said they are "not interested in doing that". After being told how desperately their students need this care, and how they are suffering, they responded with indifference and sighed with relief when the next topic was introduced.

Please boost this, the University is trying to hide behind a progressive facade while rejecting a living wage and trans care.

#transrights #uofm #goblue #trans

Edit: Please also consider donating to their strike fund. The University has stopped paying graduate workers, including some that were not on strike https://givebutter.com/GEOStrikeFund

title: Catch-23: The New C Standard Sets the World on Fire - ACM Queue

last_post.content:
This parody of Jefferson Airplane's classic song "White Rabbit" is about programming psychedelia—undefined behavior in C.

One flag makes it faster

and one flag makes it small

and the deprecated -Wchkp

doesn't do anything at all.

Go ask Lattner

if we should use -Wall.

And if you go comparing pointers

across segments you're going to fall.

That's how a hookah-smoking working group

has standardized it all.

Go ask Lattner

did they make the right call?

When your loops and expressions

get up from where you said they go

and Clang just had some kind of warning

and Valgrind is moving slow,

go ask Lattner;

I hope he'll know.

When the logic of -O3

is calling your code dead

and the main() task is writing backwards

while the workers race ahead,

remember what the Helgrind said:

Lock your thread. Lock your thread.

https://queue.acm.org/detail.cfm?id=3588242

title: FACT SHEET: Biden-Harris Administration Announces New Actions to Promote Responsible AI Innovation that Protects Americans’ Rights and Safety | The White House

last_post.content:
Biden-⁠Harris Administration Announces New Actions to Promote Responsible AI Innovation that Protects Americans’ Rights and Safety

• National Science Foundation funding to launch seven new National AI Research Institutes, bringing the total number of Institutes to 25

• Commitment from industry-leading AI developers into public evaluations and responsible disclosure

• OMB to release a draft policy on the use of AI systems by the U.S. government for public comment

https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/05/04/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-announces-new-actions-to-promote-responsible-ai-innovation-that-protects-americans-rights-and-safety/

Mozilla's taking an interesting lead here as a NGO (with their resources) to help bolster the Fediverse. The fact that moderation and safety isn't an afterthought is reassuring. https://www.theverge.com/23710406/mozilla-social-mastodon-fediverse-moderation

And taking a step to look how to incorporate public services instead of celebrities and politicians should be onboarded (since they provide more immediate value to the other 99% of the users) is dope! (https://jacky.wtf/2023/5/iTV4)

title: Movie Licensing USA: Public Libraries | Swank Motion Pictures

last_post.content:
My library is showing A Wrinkle In Time as a good movie book tie-in for their youth programming. It's going to be fun! However, this is how we have to advertise it (with no title) because of idiotic copyright laws and licensing agreements.

This is not to say that all copyright is idiotic (though some of it is), but that public library movie licensing is dumb. We get a blanket license from the State of Vermont through SWANK. Details here.

https://www.swank.com/public-libraries/customer-hub/

This is how the FBI unmasked the person behind a service that allowed criminals to check whether a credit card was valid and active.

It took them 10 years and undercover work that revealed the service was processing millions of credit card numbers.

One of the keys in the investigation was that the suspect, named Denis Kulkov, stored evidence of his crimes in his email account.

https://techcrunch.com/2023/05/04/try2check-credit-card-fraudster/

title: Meet Oleh Shostak, Ukrainian Wikipedia’s most prolific editor

last_post.content:
Meet Oleh Shostak, #Ukrainian #Wikipedia’s most prolific editor

https://diff.wikimedia.org/2023/05/03/meet-oleh-shostak-ukrainian-wikipedias-most-prolific-editor/

He's made 370,000+ edits to the Ukrainian-language Wikipedia over the past 13 years, more than any other editor!

"I started editing Wikipedia, because I realized that there was no article about my favorite plant – haworthia. This was my first article."

We welcome contributions focusing on data analysis, data set preparation and/or software development for history research.

title: Judicial activist directed fees to Clarence Thomas’s wife, urged ‘no mention of Ginni’

last_post.content: Conservative judicial activist Leonard Leo arranged for the wife of #SCOTUS Justice Clarence Thomas to be paid tens of thousands of dollars for consulting work just over a decade ago, specifying that her name be left off billing paperwork, according to documents reviewed by The Washington Post. https://www.washingtonpost.com/investigations/2023/05/04/leonard-leo-clarence-ginni-thomas-conway/
